Daughter of him at whose command</br>The sword devours a guilty land,</br>Who calls the furies from the realms profound,</br>And bids Destruction walk the dreadful round,
Tho' stranger long to Britain's isle,</br>Propitious deign at length to smile,</br>At length propitious deign to turn afar</br>The horrid edge of wide-destroying War.
Britain, with native blood distain'd,</br>Implores at length thy saving hand,</br>While War licentious spreads the ample plain</br>With blood, and dust, and mountains of the slain.
From the fair mansions of the sky,</br>Where thou, enthron'd, dost sit on high,</br>Goddess, descend!  thou of celestial birth,</br>Revisit once again the sons of earth.
For thee at first th' Almighty Pow'r</br>Call'd forth in the creating hour,</br>Bade jarring elements their discord cease,</br>And anarch Chaos yield the throne to Peace.
Descend, bright Pow'r, and bring with thee</br>Thy well-belov'd, fair Liberty;</br>And Plenty blithe, that 'midst thy shining train,</br>Her flowing tresses decks with golden grain.
Thy balm the rankling wounds can heal,</br>Deep open'd by the vengeful steel;</br>Thy lenient arts the glowing pangs assuage,</br>Of foreign tumult, and intestine rage.
Long on the globe thy gifts dispense,</br>On Britain shed thy influence:</br>With joy her sons, with plenty deck her plain,</br>That Wealth and Peace may speak a happier reign.</br>
